guild.description:
Place where people document the fall of Microsoft Windows. 

Windows 10 for instance is a privacy nightmare. Reading the EULA before installation and accepting it confirms all of your information to belong to Microsoft. 

You practically do NOT own your computer or control what happens in it, using Microsoft Windows. 

Many people seem terrified of freedom for one reason or another. In growing numbers though, people are choosing freedom when ever it actually is possible and it has never been more so than currently!

Freedom respecting operating systems and software in general are all there to replace the Microsoft ones.

body: They did this to me. Locked my 15 year old account with tons of family photos and videos including the last of my MIL, who died last year. I contacted them and was told I was in "gross violation of TOS and we are unable to discuss it further". I have to keep using MS for work but I refuse to put anything of importance on OneDrive anymore. Everything is gone.
body_html: They did this to me. Locked my 15 year old account with tons of family photos and videos including the last of my MIL, who died last year. I contacted them and was told I was in "gross violation of TOS and we are unable to discuss it further". I have to keep using MS for work but I refuse to put anything of importance on OneDrive anymore. Everything is gone.

body:
This is a scam. If it were actually a ban (which it is according to the message) you wouldn't get unbanned by giving them your phone number. The only case where that would happen is for your own protection if someone hacked your account.

Edit: [Actually it is real](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/account-billing/account-has-been-locked-805e8b0d-4141-29b2-7b65-df6ff6c9ce27) but it appears they have extremely bad wording.

> We've noticed some unusual activity on your account. To help protect you from potential fraud or abuse, we've temporarily locked your account. We know this is frustrating, but we can help you get back into your account with just a few steps.
body_html:
This is a scam. If it were actually a ban (which it is according to the message) you wouldn't get unbanned by giving them your phone number. The only case where that would happen is for your own protection if someone hacked your account.

Edit: Actually it is real but it appears they have extremely bad wording.

We've noticed some unusual activity on your account. To help protect you from potential fraud or abuse, we've temporarily locked your account. We know this is frustrating, but we can help you get back into your account with just a few steps.

body:
This screams scam to me. There's no reason  Make sure you actually call microsoft's real number. Remember these scams can look quite real. That's the only reason why I can see that it would want your phone number of all things to get unbanned.

Edit: [Apparently it's real](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/account-billing/account-has-been-locked-805e8b0d-4141-29b2-7b65-df6ff6c9ce27) but so is the method to get back in:

> We've noticed some unusual activity on your account. To help protect you from potential fraud or abuse, we've temporarily locked your account. We know this is frustrating, but we can help you get back into your account with just a few steps.

Looks like their wording is really bad. Use the phone number.
body_html:
This screams scam to me. There's no reason Make sure you actually call microsoft's real number. Remember these scams can look quite real. That's the only reason why I can see that it would want your phone number of all things to get unbanned.

Edit: Apparently it's real but so is the method to get back in:

We've noticed some unusual activity on your account. To help protect you from potential fraud or abuse, we've temporarily locked your account. We know this is frustrating, but we can help you get back into your account with just a few steps.

Looks like their wording is really bad. Use the phone number.

body:
Cloud computing is a total scam in regards to the average private citizen - it's like giving all your photos, DVDs, CDs, tools, toys and winter clothing to your employer because he promises he'll let you access it when you ask him for it back.

Never understood why the average person even considers it.
body_html:
Cloud computing is a total scam in regards to the average private citizen - it's like giving all your photos, DVDs, CDs, tools, toys and winter clothing to your employer because he promises he'll let you access it when you ask him for it back.

Never understood why the average person even considers it.

body: Try again. You likely just got a rude operator. Microsoft isn't like reddit with only a few admins controlling everything, it's way too big for that and there's bound to be some good employees and bad ones. 90% of them have probably never even met the higher ups.

body: That's just it, there was no operator. When I called the number it said the entire operation was automated due to covid and I could only reset or fix the issue online. No option to speak to someone. I pressed buttons, yelled at the phone, tried other departments - nothing. It's been a couple of months now, it's probably been purged. I have a feeling it's because I had some stuff linked to my blog and, well, conservative "mexican american"...yeah, not the kind of person MS likes. I think someone reported my OneDrive being linked to my blog and that's why the kicked it.

No option to speak to someone. I pressed buttons, yelled at the phone, tried other departments - nothing. It's been a couple of months now, it's probably been purged. I have a feeling it's because I had some stuff linked to my blog and, well, conservative "mexican american"...yeah, not the kind of person MS likes. I think someone reported my OneDrive being linked to my blog and that's why the kicked it.

body:
I submitted a ticked through the web portal they provided on the notification page that my account had been locked. Sent in my first request 09/16/20, didnt get a reply until 10/15/20. This was the reply:

"Hi,

We evaluated your appeal and verified your account was properly closed for a serious violation of the Microsoft Services Agreement. https://www.microsoft.com/servicesagreement/default.aspx#3_codeOfConduct.

Pursuant to our terms, we cannot reactivate your account, nor provide details as to why it was closed. 

This represents Microsoft’s final communication regarding this account.

Krissy
Microsoft Online Safety"

I've attempted communication a few times afterward, but as you can see its been months and my data has likely been purged. Very sad. My son's graduation from boot camp was in there.
body_html:
I submitted a ticked through the web portal they provided on the notification page that my account had been locked. Sent in my first request 09/16/20, didnt get a reply until 10/15/20. This was the reply:

"Hi,

We evaluated your appeal and verified your account was properly closed for a serious violation of the Microsoft Services Agreement. https://www.microsoft.com/servicesagreement/default.aspx#3_codeOfConduct.

Pursuant to our terms, we cannot reactivate your account, nor provide details as to why it was closed.

This represents Microsoft’s final communication regarding this account.

Krissy Microsoft Online Safety"

I've attempted communication a few times afterward, but as you can see its been months and my data has likely been purged. Very sad. My son's graduation from boot camp was in there.

body: Threaten them with legal action. They'll most likely just cave and give you your account back. I'm pretty sure both data theft and not following the TOS is actually illegal, but even if it's not they won't want to put up with all that legal crap. I don't think the data would've been purged, as they're obligated to reverse it in case they made a mistake. The *only* provider I know of that does this is Google, and that takes nearly 2 years from what I've seen.
body_html: Threaten them with legal action. They'll most likely just cave and give you your account back. I'm pretty sure both data theft and not following the TOS is actually illegal, but even if it's not they won't want to put up with all that legal crap. I don't think the data would've been purged, as they're obligated to reverse it in case they made a mistake. The only provider I know of that does this is Google, and that takes nearly 2 years from what I've seen.

parent.body:
I submitted a ticked through the web portal they provided on the notification page that my account had been locked. Sent in my first request 09/16/20, didnt get a reply until 10/15/20. This was the reply:

"Hi,

We evaluated your appeal and verified your account was properly closed for a serious violation of the Microsoft Services Agreement. https://www.microsoft.com/servicesagreement/default.aspx#3_codeOfConduct.

Pursuant to our terms, we cannot reactivate your account, nor provide details as to why it was closed. 

This represents Microsoft’s final communication regarding this account.

Krissy
Microsoft Online Safety"

I've attempted communication a few times afterward, but as you can see its been months and my data has likely been purged. Very sad. My son's graduation from boot camp was in there.

body: Its in TOS. All they have to do is say "you are in violation" and they don't have to disclose any information on the violation. Any attempt at legal action would likely be met with "You agreed to Terms of Service, tough luck". I had hoped some posts on Reddit might have caught someone's attention who could help me, but trying to post on the MS subreddit over there was very annoying and my post kept getting rejected because I guess words in the post didn't match required flair and so I just got tired and stopped.
body_html: Its in TOS. All they have to do is say "you are in violation" and they don't have to disclose any information on the violation. Any attempt at legal action would likely be met with "You agreed to Terms of Service, tough luck". I had hoped some posts on Reddit might have caught someone's attention who could help me, but trying to post on the MS subreddit over there was very annoying and my post kept getting rejected because I guess words in the post didn't match required flair and so I just got tired and stopped.

body: They won't tell you what the violation was but they will have to be able to tell that to a court. Even if they are in the right they won't want to bother with a lawsuit. Some bored employee sitting in their office probably doesn't recognize how serious the problem is unless you do that, they likely just think you're a regular user who just used email and games and stuff. I'm also pretty sure there's laws about that kind of data theft.

body: I don't think that will be necessary. Like I said even the threat of legal action will probably scare them. Defense costs time and money too even if they prove themselves innocent and it's easier to just cave to giving your account back. If by chance they don't respond to that then go ask lawyers.
body_html: I don't think that will be necessary. Like I said even the threat of legal action will probably scare them. Defense costs time and money too even if they prove themselves innocent and it's easier to just cave to giving your account back. If by chance they don't respond to that then go ask lawyers.

guild.description:
Place where people document the fall of Microsoft Windows. 

Windows 10 for instance is a privacy nightmare. Reading the EULA before installation and accepting it confirms all of your information to belong to Microsoft. 

You practically do NOT own your computer or control what happens in it, using Microsoft Windows. 

Many people seem terrified of freedom for one reason or another. In growing numbers though, people are choosing freedom when ever it actually is possible and it has never been more so than currently!

Freedom respecting operating systems and software in general are all there to replace the Microsoft ones.

Many people seem terrified of freedom for one reason or another. In growing numbers though, people are choosing freedom when ever it actually is possible and it has never been more so than currently!

post.body: ...And if one has violated the agreement, why does providing a phone number make up for that? Microsoft is phonewalled now or something?
